title: Judge Rejects Trump Plan to Switch Legal Team in Census Case
summary: Government failed to provide 'satisfactory reasons' to change attorneys, judge finds, in case over citizenship question. A federal judge in New York on Tuesday rejected the Trump administration's plan to switch legal teams in the census case, throwing another wrench into the government's drive to overcome a Supreme Court ruling that blocked its plan to ask every U.S. household how many residents are citizens.

title: Prosecuting Alex Acosta
summary: Democrats try to blame the Labor Secretary for Jeffrey Epstein.. In case you hadn't heard, billionaire Jeffrey Epstein was charged on Monday in New York with child sex trafficking. But judging by the political reaction, you'd think Labor Secretary Alex Acosta was the arraigned miscreant. Democrats are now stringing up Mr. Acosta for prosecutorial judgments he made a decade ago as a U.S. Attorney despite no evidence of wrongdoing.

title: Poland Frees Ex-Official Accused of Spying for China
summary: Ex-counterintelligence agent was jailed in January alongside a Chinese executive of Huawei's Polish unit. WARSAW-Poland released a local ex-counterintelligence official who had been detained on charges of spying for China, as Polish and Chinese ministers met in an effort to ease tensions between Beijing and one of the U.S.'s closest allies in Europe.

title: H. Ross Perot, Texas Billionaire Who Twice Ran for President, Dies at 89
summary: He rose from Depression-era poverty to become one of the country's richest men as founder of computer-services giant EDS. H. Ross Perot, a computer-services pioneer whose two outsider presidential campaigns tapped into some of the antiestablishment sentiments that later propelled Donald Trump to the White House, died Tuesday at his home in Dallas. He was 89 years old and had leukemia.

title: People Power, Hong Kong-Style
summary: The Beijing-backed government retreats on an extradition bill.. We keep reading about the relentless march of authoritarian government, but the liberal pessimists didn't reckon with the people of Hong Kong. Against all odds, their recent protests against a bill to allow extradition to Mainland China have forced the Hong Kong government to back down.

title: A Fund That Will Never Run Dry
summary: Some Republicans want to put another federal program on autopilot.. It may not seem like Congress is doing much these days, but most of what it is doing isn't helpful. One bad idea moving fast would put a fund for buying private land on autopilot.

title: Apple Music, Spotify Tap Live Events to Stand Out
summary: Pop stars like Taylor Swift and the Jonas Brothers appear in concerts, music-release parties for fans identified by listening habits. When Taylor Swift takes the stage Wednesday night in New York City, only around 2,000 fans will be on hand to see the concert in person, but millions more are expected to watch live online via Amazon.com Inc.'s Prime Day promotion.

title: Rebuking Trump on Drug Prices
summary: HHS exceeded its authority to mandate price disclosure.. One abuse of the Trump years has been federal judges who exceed their power to strike down directives they don't like on policy grounds, from association health plans to the travel ban. But on Monday the Trump Administration received a deserved rebuke on an extralegal rule on drug pricing.

title: Appeals Court Signals Peril for Affordable Care Act
summary: Judges question whether the health law can survive if its insurance mandate is unconstitutional. NEW ORLEANS-A federal appeals court on Tuesday voiced skepticism that a central feature of the Affordable Care Act is constitutional, though it appeared to struggle with whether that meant the Obama-era health law should be struck down in its entirety.

title: Norwest Venture Partners Invests in Autism Specialist Gateway Learning
summary: The investment represents the latest plunge into autism therapy providers by private-equity firms. Norwest Venture Partners has invested in Gateway Learning Group Inc., the latest infusion of capital by private-equity firms in companies that focus on autism.

title: Airbus Poised to Overtake Boeing as Biggest Plane Maker
summary: Boeing reported no new orders of 737 MAX aircraft for third straight month following two fatal crashes. Boeing Co. is poised to lose its place as the world's largest plane maker to Airbus SE after a reign of seven years, as its jetliner deliveries fell by more than a third in the first half of 2019 with the grounding of its 737 MAX aircraft.

title: Border Apprehensions Decline for First Time Since January
summary: Arrests of people illegally crossing border typically decline in June, as temperatures rise. The number of people arrested while illegally crossing the U.S. border with Mexico and those who requested asylum at ports of entry dropped 28% in June, the first decline since January, the Trump administration said.

title: U.S., Britain Swap Insults on Social Media
summary: President Trump calls U.K. envoy Kim Darroch 'very stupid'; attacks pose challenge to Britain's next leader. The special U.S.-British relationship is now being managed on Twitter-and it isn't going well.

title: Congress Is Coming for Your IRA
summary: The Secure Act would upend 20 years of retirement planning and stick it to the middle class.. Like grave robbers opening King Tut's tomb, Congress can't wait to get its hands on America's retirement-account assets. The House passed the Setting Every Community Up for Retirement Enhancement Act, known by the acronym Secure, in May. The vote was 417-3. The Secure Act is widely expected to pass the Senate by unanimous consent. While ostensibly helping Americans save for retirement, the bill would actually reduce the value of all retirement savings plans: individual retirement accounts, 401(k)s, Roth IRAs, the works.

title: Getting Iran Out of Syria Is No Easy Task
summary: Israeli air power isn't enough. And it's not clear the Russians could do it even if they were willing.. Israel has undertaken at least 200 air raids against Iranian targets in Syria since 2017. Mossad head Yossi Cohen said at a security conference in Herzliya recently that Israel's objective is to make Iran "reach the conclusion that it is just not worth it" to continue its project in Syria.

title: Democrats May Inflate Another Housing Bubble
summary: Subsidies and regulations created the 2008 crisis. Guess what the 2020 candidates are proposing.. Politicians and regulators played a central role in the housing boom and bust that led to the 2008 financial crisis. But you'd never know that, judging from the Democratic presidential candidates' housing proposals, which double down on the policies and interventions that caused the problem in the first place.

title: Notable & Quotable: A Proposed Congressional Resolution on Climate Change
summary: 'Nothing in this concurrent resolution constitutes a declaration of a national emergency.'. From a resolution introduced July 9 "expressing the sense of Congress that there is a climate emergency which demands a massive-scale mobilization to halt, reverse, and address its consequences and causes":

title: U.K. Regulator Imposes Record Fine Total Against Individuals
summary: Record comes as the U.K.'s leading financial regulator increasingly focuses on criminal cases and on investigating entities and individuals, lawyers said. The U.K's Financial Conduct Authority issued the largest total amount in fines against individuals during the 2019 fiscal year, the regulator said in its annual report published Tuesday.

title: U.K. Audits Continue to Miss Quality Targets Set by Regulator
summary: FRC says 75% of audits conducted on large U.K. companies were good; it wants 90% of audits to meet that goal. Financial statement audits of large British companies continue to miss regulatory standards, according to the U.K.'s Financial Reporting Council. The finding comes as the country's audit sector braces for a potential shake-up amid concerns around the quality of such assessments.

title: Trump and the Sex Offender
summary: Guess why the press makes a villain out of Jeffrey Epstein's only successful prosecutor?. Anybody who has read about Jeffrey Epstein in the past dozen years would come away with the same impression Mr. Epstein apparently had about himself. The guy will soon be back in jail.

title: Mirroring Trump Could Doom the Democrats
summary: They need a moderate alternative. If Biden declines to step up, others may do so.. The only cure for bad politics is better politics. The only remedy for national division is national leadership that puts reconciliation first.

title: I'm Jim Sterba, and So Is He
summary: In 1989 I learned that another writer shares my name. Google isn't making things easier.. It's the 30th anniversary of the fall of the Berlin Wall, cracks in the Soviet Union, the Tiananmen massacre, "Driving Miss Daisy's" best-picture Oscar, and my report in this paper about the other James P. Sterba.

title: Where Did All the Faith Go?
summary: Students discuss causes of religion's decline among young people, including social justice, social media and secular schools.. Editor's note: This Future View addresses the decline of religion among young adults. For next time, we'll tackle the "woke corporation"-think Nike canceling a sneaker with the Betsy Ross flag-and ask, "Why are big companies increasingly taking progressive stances on divisive social issues, and what does it mean for the culture war?" Students should click here to submit opinions of fewer than 250 words before July 23. The best responses will be published that night.

title: 'A History of the Bible' Review: Scripture Under Scrutiny
summary: Many scholars seek a middle path between reverencing the Bible and dismissing it as a pack of delusions. If only it were that easy.. 'In truth," writes John Barton at the beginning of "A History of the Bible," "there are no versions of either Christianity or Judaism that correspond point for point to the contents of the Bible, which is often not what it has been made into and read as." That is a gentle way of putting it. What he means, as he goes on to show over the next 200 pages, is that the Old and New Testaments (to use the Christian terminology) are a shapeless collection of frequently incompatible writings whose origins and aims are largely unknowable and whose historical claims are woefully untrustworthy.

title: U.S. Levies Sanctions Against Hezbollah Members
summary: The action, the first time the U.S. has targeted Hezbollah's parliamentarians, escalates the administration's pressure against Iran and its allies. WASHINGTON-The Trump administration levied sanctions against two Hezbollah members of Lebanon's parliament and a senior security official in the organization, which the U.S. designated a terrorist group in 1997.

title: Billionaire Steyer Is Running for President
summary: Democrat has called for impeachment proceedings against Trump. Billionaire Tom Steyer plans to spend at least $100 million on his White House run, his newly launched campaign said, as the environmental activist moves to put his deep pockets to work in the crowded Democratic presidential field.

title: Some New York City Preschool Teachers to Get Pay Bump Under Tentative Deal
summary: Agreement aims to bring staff at community-based centers to parity with district instructors. Mayor Bill de Blasio and union leaders announced a tentative deal Tuesday that would boost pay for certified teachers in many community-based early childhood centers in New York City, in a move to help them recruit and retain staff.

title: House Democrats Seek Closed-Door Testimony of Mueller Deputies
summary: Two former prosecutors on special counsel's team in negotiations to testify the same day as Robert Mueller's open hearing. WASHINGTON-House Democrats are seeking to hear from two senior deputies to former special counsel Robert Mueller in closed-door testimony on Capitol Hill next week, the latest attempt to learn more about the Russia investigation in the face of Mr. Mueller's vow to only discuss the facts laid out in his report.

title: 'I Do Not Know What It Is I Am Like: The Art of Bill Viola' Review: Spirituality in an Age of Irony
summary: Though underwhelming as a survey of the video artist's oeuvre, the Barnes Foundation's new exhibition includes works alive with mystery and meaning.. Philadelphia

title: A New York Duck-Farm Tour Didn't Sell Me on Foie Gras
summary: This isn't Farmer Brown's Pondside Paradise, but neither is it the fifth circle of hell I'd imagined. When Marcus Henley testified last month at a City Council hearing considering a foie gras sales ban in New York City, he issued an interesting invitation: Come visit!

title: U.S. Seizes MSC Container Ship After Record Drug Bust
summary: MSC Gayane could be taken over by authorities after 20 tons of cocaine were found in containers Philadelphia port. U.S. authorities have seized a large container ship operated by Switzerland-based Mediterranean Shipping Co., three weeks after customs authorities found 20 tons of cocaine on the vessel.

title: Powell May Face More Questions on Fed's Approach to Climate Change
summary: Some Democratic lawmakers have pressed the central bank to be more active in efforts to mitigate global warming risks. Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell's views on interest rates and the economy should be the main focus as he testifies before Congress on Wednesday and Thursday, but he also may field questions on what the central bank is doing to address climate change risks.

title: Can Trump Keep Bosses Happy?
summary: The President greets an ally eager to invest in America, but U.S. CEOs may not share his optimism.. There has almost never been a better time to look for a job in America. But while rising wages and a tight labor market are great news for workers, the people who run U.S. businesses are lately feeling rather pessimistic. Can an economy continue to make employees happy if their bosses aren't?

title: D.C. Attorney General Sues Marriott Over Fees
summary: Prosecutors claim hotelier conceals true total price of its hotel rooms by tacking on resort fees, amenity fees or destination fees on top of advertised price. The attorney general for the District of Columbia is suing Marriott International Inc. for allegedly hiding the true price of hotel rooms from consumers and charging hidden fees, a sign that hoteliers are facing more resistance over what they charge.

title: Harvard Dismisses Fencing Coach Over Conflict-of-Interest Violation
summary: Veteran team leader was said to have sold his home to a parent for nearly double its valuation. Harvard University has dismissed its longtime fencing coach in the wake of an investigation into financial transactions he made with the family of a current and former student on his team, highlighting concerns about the potential for corruption in college athletics and admissions.

title: Ghost Ship Fire Defendant Takes Stand
summary: Concert venue's leaseholder faults city and building owner for Oakland blaze that killed 36. OAKLAND, Calif.-The man prosecutors blame for the 2016 warehouse blaze that killed 36 people took the stand in his own defense this week, faulting city officials and the building's owner for the fire while saying he is remorseful.

title: Cisco to Buy Acacia Communications for About $2.6 Billion
summary: Shares in Acacia, a maker of modules and semiconductors, soar after deal announcement. Cisco Systems Inc. has agreed to buy equipment manufacturer Acacia Communications Inc. for about $2.6 billion, as it looks to serve rising performance demands on networking gear from data center operators and telecom-service providers.

title: Powell's Approach to Interest Rates Wins Bipartisan Backing
summary: Lawmakers defend Fed chief against attacks from Trump; Sen. Toomey says removing Powell 'would be a very bad idea'. President Trump's relentless public criticism of the man he picked to run the Federal Reserve, Jerome Powell, isn't broadly shared by lawmakers who confirmed the central bank leader to his post last year.

title: Michael Flynn Won't Be Called to Testify in Trial, in Shift
summary: The move could complicate the former Trump adviser's effort to obtain a lenient sentence for lying to federal agents. Federal prosecutors won't call Mike Flynn to testify at the trial of a business associate accused of crimes stemming from foreign lobbying work, suggesting in court filings they don't believe the former White House national security adviser will tell the truth on the witness stand.

title: Drugmakers Rise After Trump Pricing Rule Is Blocked
summary: Eli Lilly and Mylan among the gainers after judge's decision on consumer advertising. Shares of drugmakers are rallying on hopes of greater pricing flexibility.

title: Hunt for Mississippi Prison Escapees Enters Fifth Day
summary: 'No confirmed sightings' of inmates who escaped Friday, said department of corrections commissioner. A manhunt is under way in Mississippi after two inmates escaped a state prison Friday morning, leaving behind few hints for local, state and federal law enforcement.

title: New York Clerk Sues Over Law Granting Driver's Licenses to Illegal Immigrants
summary: Erie County Clerk Michael Kearns says the state measure would force officials to violate federal law. ALBANY, N.Y.-The official responsible for issuing driver's licenses in Western New York's largest county is suing state leaders to halt a new law allowing illegal immigrants to apply for the documents.

title: Twitter to Flag Users for Speech Offending Religious Groups
summary: Language that 'dehumanizes on the basis of religion' will prompt tweet's removal. Twitter Inc. said it has updated its policy on hateful conduct to better protect religious groups, the latest effort by the company to police speech and curb abuse on its platform despite the potential risk of offending some users.

title: A Legal Roadmap to the Epstein Prosecution
summary: Prosecutors claim to have 'detailed, credible and corroborated' victim accounts; Epstein's lawyers claim an earlier deal shelters him from prosecution. Financier Jeffrey Epstein pleaded not guilty Monday to two counts related to sex-trafficking of minors in an indictment unsealed in federal court in Manhattan.

title: Stocks Mixed as Tech Gains Balance With Trade Anxiety
summary: Investors await fresh commentary from Fed Chairman Powell. Major U.S. stock indexes posted mixed results Tuesday, pulled back and forth by enthusiasm for hot tech stocks, anxiety about trade-dispute fallout and speculation that central bankers will do their best to keep the global economy growing.

title: World's Coffee Growers Seek to Set Minimum Price to Help Poor Farmers
summary: Many growers are switching to other crops or abandoning plantations altogether amid lowest prices in over a decade. SÃO PAULO-Can you make an OPEC-style cartel for coffee?

title: Fed Wants to Teach Banks Through Stress Tests, Not Fail Them
summary: Randal Quarles says Fed is considering ways to make process more transparent. BOSTON-A top Federal Reserve official said his agency's tests of whether big banks can withstand a future economic shock need to be more predictable and easier for firms to pass.

title: IBM Closes Its Red Hat Purchase, a Deal With High Stakes for Rometty
summary: Acquisition of open-source software company for $34 billion fits into IBM's efforts to gain on competitors in cloud computing. International Business Machines Corp. closed its roughly $34 billion acquisition of open-source software company Red Hat Inc., the company said, a deal for the 108-year-old tech giant that will help define Chief Executive Ginni Rometty's legacy.

title: U.S. Job Openings Slipped in May to 7.3 Million
summary: Number of available jobs exceeded the number of unemployed Americans by 1.4 million, remains near record high. WASHINGTON-The number of unfilled jobs in the U.S. fell slightly in May, but remained near record levels, suggesting demand for workers was strong even during a month when hiring slowed sharply.

title: President Trump Can't Block Twitter Users, Federal Appeals Court Rules
summary: Practice of blocking users violates free-speech protections, judges say. A federal appeals court in New York ruled President Trump's practice of blocking some users on Twitter violates the free-speech protections of the First Amendment.

title: Deutsche Bank Shares Continue to Fall
summary: Investors, analysts cautious on bank's overhaul and growth projections. Deutsche Bank AG shares slid a second day as investors and analysts questioned the German lender's growth projections and management's grip on a restructuring that is more complicated and far-reaching than previous, failed overhauls.

title: The New Games in Town
summary: Analysts caution that Battle Royale games like Fortnite and Apex face competition from a new genre. The battle lines can shift quickly in today's videogame business.

title: Oil Prices End Higher
summary: Prices are pulled between demand concerns and risks to supply. Oil prices closed higher Tuesday, after being pulled between demand concerns and risks to supply throughout the day.

title: Government Bond-Market Measure Says Recession Risk Growing
summary: Yield on short-term Treasurys has been higher than on long-term notes for more than 30 consecutive trading sessions. The yield on short-term Treasurys has been higher than on long-term notes for more than 30 consecutive trading sessions, a sign that investors are concerned about the durability of the decadelong economic expansion.

title: Dyal Pitches New Debt Strategy for Alternative Asset Managers
summary: The Neuberger Berman unit has already raised about $1 billion for the new strategy. Dyal Capital Partners, a unit of Neuberger Berman Group LLC best known for buying stakes in private-equity firms, has a new pitch: providing loans to them.

title: U.S. and Qatar Shore Up Ties as Emir Visits White House
summary: As relations improve despite Saudi-led boycott, emirate signs deals for plane and missile buys. WASHINGTON-President Trump hailed the emir of Qatar as a friend and applauded a "large transaction" between the two countries as the emirate moved to finalize a number of energy and aircraft agreements with the U.S.

title: Virginia's Lawmakers End Special Session Without Voting on Gun Bills
summary: Democratic Gov. Ralph Northam had called session to consider gun-control measures. The Republican-led Virginia legislature abruptly ended a special session that Democratic Gov. Ralph Northam had called to consider a raft of gun-control measures in the wake of May's deadly mass shooting in Virginia Beach.

title: How NBA Free Agency Dunked on Baseball
summary: At MLB's All-Star Game, the sport's biggest stars bemoan being overshadowed by basketball's annual free-agency bonanza. CLEVELAND-As sports fans around the world freaked out over the insanity of NBA free agency over the past 10 days, baseball players watched the madness with a different perspective.

title: Big Tech Summoned to Washington for Antitrust Hearing
summary: Executives from Google, Amazon, Facebook and Apple will appear next week. WASHINGTON-Representatives of four huge U.S. technology companies will testify next week at a hearing on "online platforms and market power," the House antitrust subcommittee said.

title: How to Throw a Ticker-Tape Parade for Women's Soccer When No One Uses Ticker Tape
summary: Resume Subscription. The U.S. women's soccer team, back from its World Cup victory, will be honored with a ticker-tape parade Wednesday in New York City, and that raises a delicate question.

title: Platinum Partners Executives Found Guilty of Fraud
summary: Mark Nordlicht and David Levy, former executives of now-defunct hedge fund, acquitted of five other charges after two-month trial. A federal jury in Brooklyn, N.Y., convicted two executives at defunct hedge fund Platinum Partners of three fraud counts while acquitting them of five other charges relating to accusations the men lied to investors about the health of their fund.

title: Give Working Parents Better Choices for Care
summary: A substantial paid maternity-leave policy should be prioritized over universal day care.. Regarding the July 5 letters responding to my June 26 op-ed "Warren vs. Warren on Government Daycare": The predominant assumption of the majority of the letters is that I don't believe in quality child care for working mothers. Some mothers and fathers have to work and need quality child care. However, I believe that providing families with money directly is preferable to using government funding to subsidize a faulty day-care system.

title: American VC Model Copied Because It Works
summary: European VC funds primarily are modeled after U.S. ones. Israel, "the startup nation," is chock-full of VC funds, both homegrown and foreign.. Marc Levinson's July 2 Bookshelf review of Tom Nicholas's "VC: An American History" is disappointingly shallow and misinformed. Mr. Levinson seems to think that if all U.S. venture-capital funds don't average a satisfactory return, then none of them are worthy of investment. Yet the limited partners who invest in venture funds are sophisticated investors-academic endowments and the like-who wouldn't continue to invest in VC funds if they didn't feel they were profitable investments. And apart from the benefits to investors in VC funds, think of the benefits to our nation and our society derived from the support of risky startups that venture funds provide. It beggars the imagination to think of our nation without the countless medical, industrial and employment benefits yielded by VC-backed companies over the years. And that is without even considering the vital guidance and industry contacts that such funds provide to young entrepreneurs, which often is as valuable as the capital itself.

title: Lexington, Concord-Don't Forget Machias
summary: Entirely omitted between Lexington and Concord (April 18-19, 1775) and Bunker Hill (June 17) is the Battle of Machias (June 11-12).. Regarding Mark G. Spencer's review of Rick Atkinson's "The British Are Coming" (Bookshelf, July 3): Mr. Atkinson is indeed an outstanding popular historian and his new work is a great read, but nobody's perfect. With his intensive focus on ground combat, he is what the German army called landsinnig or land-minded.

title: Virtue Signaling By 19 Who Can Well Afford to Posture
summary: This is virtue signaling with no cost to the virtue. At that cost there are lots of people who are potential advocates of government redistribution.. I assume your editorial advice to the billionaires who advocate a wealth tax is at least partially tongue-in-cheek, in the sense that you didn't expect them to follow that advice ("An Open Letter to Patriotic Billionaires," June 27).

title: Tuskegee Airman Puts Colin Kaepernick in Perspective
summary: Harry Stewart's "A Tuskegee Airman Turns 95" (op-ed, July 3) filled me with pride and hope for America. He fought for his country in the 1940s in spite of the open, hostile discrimination in the country.. I was a day late getting through my Journal when I came across Harry Stewart's "A Tuskegee Airman Turns 95" (op-ed, July 3), which filled me with pride and hope for America. He fought for his country in the 1940s in spite of the open, hostile discrimination in the country. Decades later, his closing statement is "America was not perfect in the 1940s and is not perfect today, yet I fought for it then and would do so again."

title: Time For Congress to Act On Youth-Vaping Epidemic
summary: When are the FDA and Congress going to do something, anything, to combat this epidemic? Parents like myself are totally frustrated by the lack of action.. Regarding "The FDA's Challenge On E-Cigs" (op-ed, June 25): Dr. Scott Gottlieb has called vaping an "epidemic." Yet, I see nothing but coulds: "The FDA could allow vape stores," and cans: "the FDA can carve out." The principal at my daughter's high school believes at least 50% of the students vape regularly. When are the FDA and Congress going to do something, anything, to combat this epidemic? Parents like myself are totally frustrated by the lack of action.

title: Italian Leader Extols Closing of Migrant Center
summary: Deputy Prime Minister Matteo Salvini hails 'a beautiful day for the country's legality and security'. Matteo Salvini, Italy's nativist deputy prime minister and one of Europe's most vocal anti-immigration leaders, presided over the closure of a migrant reception center that was once the largest such structure on the continent during the region's migration crisis.

title: Fire Up the Grill: Propane Prices Have Tumbled
summary: Households that are heated with the fuel could receive lower bills this autumn. Crude-oil and natural-gas prices have had bad years, but neither can hold a candle to propane, which has lost roughly half of its value over the past 12 months.

title: Crushed by U.S. Sanctions, Iran Pins Economic Hopes on Mall Developer
summary: Saeed Mohammed seeks to use the business might of the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps to stabilize Iran's teetering economy. TEHRAN, Iran-Faced with a U.S. campaign to choke Iran of capital and investment, Saeed Mohammed is trying to find ways to keep the lifeblood of his country's economy flowing.

title: New York Condo Conversions Near the End
summary: A longtime practice that promoted homeownership, transformed neighborhoods and enriched thousands of middle-class renters is effectively over. NEW YORK-A longtime New York City practice that promoted homeownership, transformed neighborhoods and enriched thousands of middle-class renters is effectively over.

title: Why the Chore Coat Is an Ideal All-Season Blazer Alternative
summary: Originally designed for French workers, this multi-pocketed, canvas jacket has become a go-to for urban gents everywhere with good reason. FOR OVER 100 years starting around the early 1900s, many workers throughout France toiled away in a veste de travail, a marine-blue cotton work coat with three front pockets to secure their nails, seeds, lures or whatever supplies they needed. The purpose of this jacket-now known in stylish circles as a chore coat-was to last "for 10, 20 years, 30 years if necessary," said Alexandre Milan, the president of Le Mont Saint Michel, a company in the bucolic Brittany region that has produced moleskin versions, originally for local farmers and craftsmen, since 1913.

title: Troubled Gas Deal Can Energize M&A Activists
summary: A lesser-known merger between two natural-gas companies shows why recent transactions could benefit from tough corporate agitators. Activists opposing pending mergers and acquisitions can bolster their cases by pointing to a dud deal in the energy patch- EQT Corp.'s purchase of Rice Energy.

title: Transcript: WSJ Interview With Philadelphia Fed President Patrick Harker
summary: Resume Subscription. Philadelphia Fed President Patrick Harker spoke with Wall Street Journal reporter Nick Timiraos on Monday, July 8, 2019. He discussed his outlook for the economy and interest rates in an environment of heightened policy uncertainty. Here is a partial transcript of the interview, lightly edited for clarity and length.

title: Ross Spells Out Reprieve for Huawei
summary: Commerce secretary says American firms could sell technology to Chinese tech giant as a long as national security isn't at risk. WASHINGTON-Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross said the U.S. would grant licenses to U.S. companies that want to sell technology to Huawei Technologies Co. as long as the sales wouldn't put national security at risk, expanding on a pledge made last month by President Trump to Chinese President Xi Jinping.

title: Normal Service Resumed: Serena Williams Reaches Wimbledon Semifinals
summary: Despite a lack of match practice, the 23-time major winner is back in a Grand Slam semifinal. WIMBLEDON, England-Serena Williams is clearly not at her best at this Wimbledon. She's a bit slow, and appears vulnerable as rallies last longer and grow more taxing.

title: Ticker-Tape Parades Past
summary: New York celebrations for World War I, John F. Kennedy, the 2015 U.S. women's soccer team and more. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: MDC Reorganizes Media Agencies and Leaders
summary: Mark Penn to create a network uniting media operations with other units. Mark Penn, the recently installed chief executive at troubled advertising holding company MDC Partners Inc., is realigning some of its agencies and their top leaders.

title: Fabric Reigns! Why Cloth Car Seats Are Making a Comeback
summary: When it comes to auto upholstery, leather is no longer the luxury standard. High-end brands are switching to softer, swaddling fabrics like those in Queen Elizabeth's limousine. WHEN BENTLEY designed Queen Elizabeth II's state limousine in 2013, the rear seat was luxuriously adorned not in leather, but in lamb's wool. The brand's head of interior design, Darren Day, said it didn't even ask what she might prefer. "We knew. The Palace has always used West of England cloth," he said. "It's very fine, traditionally done in a very neutral color. You let the person in the car convey the majesty."

title: Photos: A Look at H. Ross Perot's Life
summary: The self-made billionaire from Texas who made a fortune selling computers was the most successful independent presidential candidate of his time.. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: BASF Sounds a Global Trade Alert
summary: The European chemical giant's troubles aren't unique and suggest wider problems as trade tensions take a toll on global businesses. As Europe suffers through a historically hot summer, its major industrial companies are feeling a different kind of heat as the fallout from the U.S.-China trade dispute spreads around the world.

title: House Panel to Weigh Subpoenas of Several Trump Officials
summary: Judiciary Committee seeks information as part of multiple probes of the administration. WASHINGTON-In an escalation of the showdown between the Trump administration and Congress, a House panel will vote this week on whether to demand testimony from a dozen current and former administration officials and confidants of President Trump who were involved in some of his business and personal dealings.

title: Iran Threatens Retaliation Over British Seizure of Its Tanker
summary: Eu foreign ministers urge Tehran to return immediately into compliance with nuclear deal. Iran's military warned it would retaliate in response to the seizure of one of its tankers by British forces in Gibraltar last week, while several European foreign ministers urged Tehran to return immediately to full compliance with the 2015 nuclear deal.

title: Buying Groceries Online: A Discriminating Guide
summary: Online grocers want us to abandon the supermarket. Is it worth making the switch?. SINCE THE DAWN of the internet age, we've been told that the iconic American grocery store will soon disappear. Huge stores that stock 40,000-plus items make as much sense today as a Tower Records, the theory goes. But grocery stores have remained largely impervious to the digital revolution-even in the wake of Amazon's 2017 purchase of Whole Foods. Only about 3% of groceries are currently bought online. Food doesn't travel as easily as an MP3 file, and habits, especially when it comes to something as intimate as food, are hard to break.

title: Afghan Leaders and Taliban Agree on a Way Forward
summary: Declaration of principles for talks on country's political future represents a step toward ending nearly 18 years of war. KABUL-Afghans took a step toward ending nearly 18 years of war, as Taliban insurgents and a range of influential political and civic leaders agreed on a set of principles for negotiations over the country's political future.

title: Branson's Virgin Galactic to Go Public
summary: Virgin Galactic would be first listed company with plans to put tourists into space. Virgin Galactic, Richard Branson's space-tourism venture, is preparing for liftoff as a publicly traded company.

title: A Ford Bronco That Rides With the Wild Donkeys

title: FAA Nominee Criticized for Handling of Pilot-Safety Complaint
summary: Opposition to appointment threatens to increase level of difficulty that Stephen Dickson would face as FAA chief. The former senior Delta Air Lines Inc. executive picked by the White House to run the Federal Aviation Administration faces Democratic opposition over his handling of a pilot's safety complaints at the carrier, a dispute that some aviation industry insiders say could hurt his ability to bolster public confidence in the agency.

title: McGrath, Former Fighter Pilot and House Candidate, to Challenge McConnell
summary: Senate majority leader has indicated he will run against Democratic calls for student-loan forgiveness and expanded government health care. WASHINGTON-Amy McGrath, the former Marine fighter pilot whose effort last year to win a GOP-held House seat as a Democrat came up short, announced on Tuesday that she would challenge Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell of Kentucky in next year's Senate race.

title: Democrats Welcome Health Law's Day in Court
summary: Democrats put health care front and center as a hearing this week could help determine the fate of the Affordable Care Act. WASHINGTON-Democrats on Capitol Hill are ringing the alarms about an appeals hearing this week that could help determine the fate of the Affordable Care Act.

title: PepsiCo Rides New Flavors and More Ads
summary: Quarterly revenue rises in both its snacks and drinks business. PepsiCo Inc. posted higher quarterly profit and sales as the food-and-beverage giant rolled out new products such as Pepsi Mango and ramped up marketing for some of its more established brands.

title: VW Stalled Bond Probe, SEC Says
summary: Judge had asked agency to explain why it took so long to sue after guilty plea in diesel case. WASHINGTON- Volkswagen AG dragged out a federal investigation into whether it defrauded U.S. bond investors who weren't told about its efforts to cheat on diesel-emissions tests, according to the government.

title: Home-Builder Rally May Lose Steam in Second Half
summary: Builders are counting on lower interest rates to spark sales. Home-builder shares soared during the first half of 2019 with help from falling interest rates, but some analysts warn that slowing home sales and a tight labor market could weigh on these companies in the second half of the year.

title: Philadelphia Fed's Harker Sees No Need for Interest-Rate Changes
summary: Harker would entertain rate cuts if he believed the economy was 'weakening substantially'. Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia President Patrick Harker said he doesn't see a compelling reason to lower interest rates given the apparent strength of the U.S. economy, though slowing global growth and uncertainty over trade policy have created clear risks to that outlook.

title: Actor Richard Thomas Got an Early Start on Broadway
summary: The Emmy-winning star of 'The Waltons' began as a 'theater brat' who made his stage debut at 7 years old. Richard Thomas, 68, is an Emmy-winning actor who played John-Boy on TV's "The Waltons" and FBI Special Agent Frank Gaad in the series "The Americans." This year, he has appeared on Showtime's "Billions" and NBC's "The Blacklist." He spoke with Marc Myers.

title: Cannabis Startup Surterra Wellness Appoints Former Kellogg CFO as Finance Chief
summary: Surterra has assembled a stable of senior executives from big international companies. Surterra Wellness Inc. Tuesday named former Kellogg Co. chief financial officer Fareed Khan as its next finance chief, the cannabis startup's latest senior appointment as it seeks to capitalize on legal marijuana sales.

title: REITs Amass Cheaper-but Riskier-Short-Term Debt
summary: REITs taking on commercial paper could be left unable to refinance if lenders suddenly lose confidence. More publicly-listed real-estate companies are taking on short-term debt, assuming additional risk to reduce their borrowing costs.

title: South Korean Follows in His Father's Footsteps-to the North
summary: Choe In-guk appears likely to fill a high-ranking role formerly held by his late parents. SEOUL-A South Korean man who defected to North Korea appears likely to fill a high-ranking role in Pyongyang's rubber-stamp legislature, a position formerly held by his late parents, who defected in 1986.

title: Bank of Canada to Remain on Hold This Week, Survey Says
summary: Majority anticipate no change over next 12 months as policy makers weigh domestic rebound against worsening global outlook. The Bank of Canada is widely expected to leave its key interest rate on hold at an announcement this week as officials balance a recent string of strong domestic data with signs of a slowing global economy.

title: Fed's Powell Says Stress Tests Must Evolve to Avoid Bank Complacency
summary: Annual exam must explore unexpected scenarios or it might fail to prepare financial system for next downturn. BOSTON-Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said stress tests of the nation's largest banks must adapt and keep firms on their toes, or the annual exam could fail to prepare the financial system for the next downturn.

title: Piper Jaffray to Buy Sandler O'Neill for $485 Million
summary: Move takes acquirer into business it has wanted: advising small and midsize banks on deals. Piper Jaffray Cos. is buying Sandler O'Neill & Partners L.P. for $485 million, combining two investment-banking firms and creating Piper Sandler Cos.

title: The Tricky Art of Being a Wellness Entrepreneur
summary: Four successful women discuss how they determine what tasks to delegate and how they stay motivated. As consumers seek to improve their bodies, minds and spirits, more entrepreneurs are starting so-called wellness companies to meet this demand.

title: U.K. Leadership Rivals Embrace Abrupt Brexit, as Split Advances
summary: Conservative leadership candidates Boris Johnson and Jeremy Hunt are each touting their willingness to leave the EU without a deal. LONDON-The two candidates to be Britain's next prime minister are vying with each other to flaunt their willingness to leave the European Union without a deal aimed at smoothing the disruption of dismantling 45 years of economic integration.

title: China's Spluttering Car Market
summary: Unfortunately for global industry, June's jump in Chinese auto sales is no more than a temporary blip. Investors shouldn't read too much in the latest signs of life in the world's largest car market.

title: Los Angeles Asks Why Earthquake Alert System Didn't Warn Residents
summary: Officials reassess threshold to alert public to quakes, as some ready for the 'Big One'. LOS ANGELES-In the aftermath of Friday's magnitude 7.1 earthquake felt throughout much of central and southern California, shaken residents are questioning whether they are prepared for a more dangerous one and why their phones didn't send any warning alerts.

title: Big Tech's Buyback Spree Nears Its Limits
summary: Surge in sector's share repurchases is outpacing its ability to fund them. Big Tech may seem immune to the recent slowdown in stock buybacks, but even the deepest pockets have their limits.

title: Regulators Eye the Auctions That Decide Which Web Ads You See
summary: To facilitate real-time bidding, which involves tens of billions of dollars, user data is made available to up to 2,000 companies. When you load a website, an electronic auction happens in milliseconds to determine which ads show up on your screen.

title: Old Boys' Club Gives Ground as More Women Join Real-Estate Boards
summary: More women than men have been added to REIT boards recently, though the vast majority of directors are still male. Public real-estate companies are adding slightly more women than men as directors to their boards, a sign that this male-dominated industry may be starting to heed a call for gender diversity.

title: Investors Shouldn't Get Used to Good News Hurting Stocks
summary: The true danger for shareholders isn't that good news pushes up rates, but that bad news reawakens the recession fears. The easy narrative after Friday's blowout jobs report was that good news on the economy is bad news for stocks, as bond yields jumped and the S&P 500 tumbled. As soon as bond yields stopped going up, stocks began to recover. There's an important lesson in that action.

title: Markets Are Calm, Then Suddenly Go Crazy. Some Investors Think They Know Why.
summary: Investors have noticed a force some call a 'gamma trap,' and use tools to estimate its size and direction in order to predict market moves. There's a powerful force at work in markets that helps explain why stocks seem to do nothing for long periods and then suddenly lurch into activity.

title: Hong Kong Leader Says Extradition Bill Is 'Dead' but Doesn't Mention Withdrawal
summary: 'We hope people will not read a different meaning just because we are using a different word,' she says. HONG KONG-Hong Kong Chief Executive Carrie Lam said a controversial bill to legalize extradition to mainland China is "dead," but her strongest statement so far on the legislation was criticized by opponents for stopping short-again-of a commitment to full withdrawal.

title: Our IT Is So Good, Let's Sell It, Firms Say
summary: Companies outside the tech industry are spinning off internal software into viable businesses. Companies outside the technology sector are stepping into the software market, selling digital tools developed by their own information-technology teams to other businesses, with some firms even spinning off technology units.

title: Mortgage Lender Stearns Holdings Files for Bankruptcy
summary: Blackstone has agreed to pump $60 million in new money as part of the balance-sheet restructuring. The parent of residential mortgage lender Stearns Lending LLC has filed for bankruptcy after agreeing with majority owner Blackstone Group LP to a debt-restructuring plan that will erase more than $180 million in bond debt from its balance sheet.

title: India's Bond Market Could Benefit From Some Sin
summary: The government is turning to international markets, which could have positive knock-on effects for corporate borrowers. While governments in emerging markets have spent decades developing domestic bond markets, the finance ministry of the world's second-most populous nation is turning to foreign-currency debt. Strangely, that might not be a bad idea.

title: Ousted Navy Admiral Repeatedly Emailed Tarnished Public Affairs Officer for Advice
summary: Adm. William Moran, who had been incoming chief of naval operations, showed judgment error, Navy determined. WASHINGTON-The admiral slated to become the new head of the U.S. Navy repeatedly sought professional advice from a former public affairs officer as he prepared for congressional testimony, speeches, conferences on Navy strategy and staffing issues, according to emails that officials say are at the center of a Pentagon controversy.

title: Marriott Faces $124 Million Fine Over Starwood Data Breach

title: Blackstone Digs In Against Pimco With Mortgage Lender Bankruptcy
summary: Chapter 11 proposal would increase Blackstone's stake in Stearns. Blackstone Group LP's proposal to recapitalize its portfolio company, Stearns Lending LLC, would increase the private-equity firm's stake in the residential mortgage lender to 100%, a rare development among corporate bankruptcies that typically wipe out shareholders.

title: China Sheds Millionaires as Slowdown Shaves Fortunes
summary: The world's richest lost $2 trillion in asset value in 2018, according to a report. SHANGHAI-China's cooling economy shrank the ranks of the country's millionaires last year, according to a consulting firm report, weighing on the total value of assets held by the rich globally.

title: Barr Sees Path to Legally Add Census Citizenship Question
summary: Attorney general doesn't explain how the Trump administration will get around high court ruling. Attorney General William Barr said Monday he expects to find a legal way to add a citizenship question to the 2020 census, less than a week after the Justice Department said it would drop the attempt in the wake of a Supreme Court decision blocking it.

title: How a Chicago Suburb Became a Center of ETFs
summary: Welcome to Wheaton, Ill., a town with a surprising connection to many of the most-important figures in the world of exchange-traded funds. title: And the No. 1 Stock-Fund Manager Is...
summary: Dennis Lynch, manager of Morgan Stanley Institutional Discovery Portfolio, tops the list in our quarterly contest's results. Boring can be beautiful. In fact, in the midst of volatile markets, being downright dull can prove the recipe for investment.

title: U.S.-Stock Funds Are Up 17% So Far in 2019
summary: Even as stocks hit highs, investors continue to send their money mostly to bond funds. The stock market keeps rising, and fund investors keep turning away.

title: The Pitfalls of 'Designated Beneficiaries' for Mutual-Fund Accounts
summary: 'Transfer on death' accounts go directly to beneficiaries upon the owner's death. But they still need to be carefully coordinated with the owner's overall estate plan.. Sometimes what seems to be simple isn't really so simple at all.

title: The Often-Ignored Benefits of 'Solo' 401(k)s
summary: These retirement-savings vehicles are great for freelancers, sole proprietors and gig-economy workers. So why haven't they been more popular?. Millions of U.S. workers rely on employer-sponsored 401(k)s to save for retirement. But what about freelancers, sole proprietors and workers in the mushrooming gig economy, or people who want to leave the corporate cocoon and strike out on their own?

title: What Investors Need to Know About Bond ETFs
summary: Money has been pouring into bond ETFs, thanks to uncertainty over the stock market. Money has poured into bond ETFs this year, amid uncertainty about the direction of stocks. A net $75.2 billion flowed into bond funds listed on U.S. exchanges in the first half of the year, compared with $56.5 billion for U.S.-listed equity ETFs, according to news and analysis site ETF.com.

title: The Impact of TV Ads on Stock Trading

A new study suggests that commercials can influence investor behavior in real time, leading to a slight boost in trading activity in the advertiser's stock.

title: Fund Investors Can Get Pre-IPO Access. But Is It Worth It?
summary: Funds often have a slim investment in pre-IPOs-and it's tough to tell what impact they have. Pre-IPO companies aren't just for big investors anymore.

title: Can Low Rates Explain High Stock Prices? Not So Fast.
summary: The S&P 500's P/E is well above its long-term average. Data suggest stocks may be overvalued, even with today's low interest rates.. title: Index-Fund Firms Gain Power, but Fall Short in Stewardship, Research Shows
summary: Professors are concerned that opportunities to help companies and the economy will be missed. title: Cannabis ETFs Aren't the Same
summary: ETFMG Alternative Harvest and AdvisorShares Pure Cannabis may track the same industry, but they are quite different in terms of holdings. A burning desire for pot stocks may leave unwary cannabis investors with more speculative investments than they realize.

summary: The fund focuses on satellite makers and other companies that get most of their revenue from space-related work. Fifty years after Apollo 11 landed on the moon, a new exchange-traded fund is reaching for the stars.

title: An S&P 500 ESG Fund Starts Strong
summary: The Xtrackers S&P 500 ESG ETF is the first U.S. exchange-traded fund to track the new ESG version of the index. The first U.S. exchange-traded fund tracking the new environmental, social and governance version of the S&P 500 is off to a solid start, underscoring the appetite for values-based investing.

title: What Is a Stock Rerating?
summary: The term, when used to describe stocks, refers to changes in investor sentiment. When Wall Street analysts use the terms "rerating," "rerate" or "derating," they are talking about something at the heart of the investing process: changes in investor sentiment.

title: Trump Rule Requiring Drug Prices in TV Ads Blocked
summary: Federal judge sides with companies, saying regulation would violate free speech. A federal judge on Monday blocked a Trump administration rule requiring drugmakers to put prices in television ads, a central part of the president's push to lower the cost of prescription medications.

title: Trump Criticizes Departing U.K. Leader May
summary: President says he will 'no longer deal with' the British ambassador to the U.S., who was critical of the administration. WASHINGTON-President Trump on Monday took a swipe at departing U.K. Prime Minister Theresa May over her handling of Brexit, while declaring that the U.S. would "no longer deal with" the British ambassador, who was critical of Mr. Trump.

title: Short Seller Targets Anta in Another Attack on China's Biggest Sportswear Company
summary: Carson Block's firm takes aim at Anta in report titled 'Turds in the Punchbowl'. Carson Block's Muddy Waters LLC, a short seller, took aim at Anta Sports Products Ltd. , becoming the third firm in little more than a year to question the financial reports of China's most valuable sportswear company.

title: Kris Kobach Launches Run for U.S. Senate Seat
summary: Critics fear divisive candidacy of the former Kansas secretary of state could cost GOP a seat. WASHINGTON-Former Kansas Secretary of State Kris Kobach on Monday launched a run for U.S. Senate, vowing to make an aggressive response to illegal immigration the top issue in his campaign and triggering alarm in Republicans who fear his divisive candidacy could cost the party an otherwise solid seat.

title: New York City Asks Supreme Court to Drop Gun Case
summary: Request comes after city loosens restrictions on transporting firearms. New York City has asked the U.S. Supreme Court to drop its planned review of a gun-rights case, saying legal disputes over transporting handguns no longer exist due to changes in city and state law.
